result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtnie S Kono was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  On April 10, 2015 Court sets attorney fees at $434.00.  Court orders the $70.00 on file be applied to the attorney fees.

1.  AODA
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtnie S Kono

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Bret Grant - defendant has paid the court costs in full last week.  Probation review hearing can be removed from the court calendar.
Probation review hearing at 02-15-2016 01:00 pm

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
9:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Lud Wurtz.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement, upon plea to count 2, will dismiss and read-in count 1.  Atty Wurtz concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged to count 2.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wurtz.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

AODA
Court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent 
Court appointed attorney fees

Court grants atty Wurtz 30 days to submit final billing for court appointed attorney fees.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
Status hearing on March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

9:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Lud Wurtz.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wurtz - has just received Discovery and requests to talk with the DA.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Court addresses the court appointed counsel payments.  Court instructs the defendant to make her payments.

Court adjourned at 9:13 a.m.
State's
Status hearing on January 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to the defendant in regards to court appointed counsel payments - to date no payments have been received and is behind 4 payments
to Atty Wurtz with copy of the criminal complaint, minutes, bail/bond and Information

to the defendant - request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints Atty Lud Wurtz.  Defendant is to pay $70.00 per week for court appointed counsel, commencing December 5, 2014.
and order - Approved, signed by the judge
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:19 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present and without an attorney.

Court instructs defendant she must pay the Clerk of Court $70.00 per week for court appointed counsel.  Defendant indicates she sent one payment directly to Attorney Haase.  Court instructs defendant to provide some proof of payment.  Court directs Clerk to contact Attorney Haase's office in regards to said payment.  

Court will appoint an attorney to represent the defendant.

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
Status hearing on December 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
and Petition to Withdraw as counsel
Defendant's

10:15 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Statement by Attorney Haase - defendant will be waiving her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - stands mute to the charges.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs case be set for Status Hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Court reminds the defendant regarding her obligation to make monthly payments towards the cost of court appointed counsel - $70.00 per week commencing December 5, 2014.

Court adjourned at 10:18 a.m.
Status hearing on December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
to Atty Jeffrey Haase with a copy of the criminal complaint, minutes and bail/bond

to the defendant - request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints AttyJeffrey Haase.  Defendant to make $70.00 per week payments and is to commence December 5, 2014 and every week thereafter.
and Order - Approved, signed by the judge

records.addlTxt:
1:12 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has made contact with numerous law firms, lists the contacts and makes statement.  Court questions defendant regarding re-payment.  Statement by defendant.  Court instructs the defendant to pay $70.00 per week for court appointed attorney fees.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
Status hearing on November 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the court, has received a petition for court appointed counsel.  Defendant concurs.  Court questions defendant regarding employment.  Statement by defendant.  Court questions defendant regarding attorneys to see if she can afford one.  Statement by defendant.  Court instructs the defendant to make contact with two other attorneys to see if she is able to afford counsel and needs to report back to the court in two weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
Status hearing on October 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:09 P.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, does not qualify for PD representation as she makes too much and requests court appointed counsel.  Court sets for status hearing in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
Status hearing on October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:19 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding counsel.  Statement by defendant, is getting a public defender.  Court instructs defendan to meet with the public defender today.  Court sets for status in 2 weeks.  Court instructs defendant regarding right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:20 p.m.
Status hearing on September 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:23 a.m.
